channel.title: Comments on: Babelgum HQ for Ireland

item.title: By: Manoj Ranaweera
item.dc:creator: Manoj Ranaweera
item.description: Sorry, it should have read -> Paul Walsh from Segala
item.content:encoded: Sorry, it should have read -> Paul Walsh from Segala

item.title: By: Manoj Ranaweera
item.dc:creator: Manoj Ranaweera
item.description:
Sorry to hijack your space.
But, you might be interested in the next NW Startup 2.0 event in Manchester UK. Please visit http://www.nwstartup20.co.uk/ for further detail. This event is free to attend. Last event was attended by Irish entrepreneur Paul Segala. We plan to extend the May 07 event to include international speakers. It would be great if we can have Irish presence.
Many thanks
Manoj (http://www.manojranaweera.com)/
item.content:encoded:
Sorry to hijack your space.

But, you might be interested in the next NW Startup 2.0 event in Manchester UK. Please visit http://www.nwstartup20.co.uk/ for further detail. This event is free to attend. Last event was attended by Irish entrepreneur Paul Segala. We plan to extend the May 07 event to include international speakers. It would be great if we can have Irish presence.

Many thanks

Manoj (http://www.manojranaweera.com/)

item.title: By: Joe Drumgoole
item.dc:creator: Joe Drumgoole
item.description:
They have head hunted Mike O'Callaghan to be COO. Mike was until recently head of the European Development Centre for Oracle and prior to that head of Localisation for Microsoft.
BABEL will run data centre operations and support out of Dublin and book all their EU revenue through Ireland.
item.content:encoded:
They have head hunted Mike O’Callaghan to be COO. Mike was until recently head of the European Development Centre for Oracle and prior to that head of Localisation for Microsoft.

BABEL will run data centre operations and support out of Dublin and book all their EU revenue through Ireland.
